text: <@U22PJPGK0> are you saying we can use HubL inside of the data columns in the Hub DB and that would generate correctly on the front?
or am I reading the conversation wrong in what is trying to be done? As far as I know, you cant connect two HubDB tables with a primary key like you can in SQL correct

I think you’re reading it wrong - you’d have to push a table ID into a column on the master table, then use that ID in some other HubDB HubL call in your template to get the data from the linked table
(at least that’s how I was imagining it working)
Ah ok I see what your saying
